job_title: Salon Assistant in Winter Haven, FL
pros: Fun work environment and great co workers
cons: None. Everyone at PSC is really great

pros: Very flexible on your hours
cons: Email system is terrible. Every time you log into a computer, you have to send a verification text. If you're also a student and have 2 emails, you're gonna miss a lot.

job_title: Work Study Student in Winter Haven, FL
pros: I feel that I was very lucky to have been able to get a work study position within Polk's HR department. It was my first job - It was a very small office environment, all women (except for one man who was at the Lakeland location), and very easy work. The were very flexible with my schedule, and were always helpful and supportive. My supervisors were the best; I always tell people, to this day, that I had the perfect first job.
cons: Of course as a work study, the pay wasn't that great - I got paid $8.60 and hour on a monthly basis. It was good as someone who didn't have any other sources of income at the time. Other than that, there weren't many cons at all.

pros: Benefits, tons of time off
cons: Pay could be a lot better. Lots of politics

pros: Excellent company very trustworthy and thoughtful
cons: Nothing really everything very great

pros: Great campus and people and cafeteria
cons: low grade pay salary low

pros: The people are super nice, and welcoming. They are also extremely flexible with your schedule, which is great as a full time student!
cons: They cap you at 25 a week, which was fine for me but may not be for others.

review_title: Took care of issues related to Audio and Video, such as projectors and the systems that controlled them.
pros:
I loved my co-workers
The hours were nice
The job was fun
cons: There was some changes made in the last year of employment, with no change in pay and no room for advancement despite being told so when I was hired. Was let go with no warning after a month of quarentining.

review_title: Quality matters unless your pass rate is low
pros: Great teams in many of the departments. Colleagues are willing to share ideas/materials to help out new professors in planning. Best thing is getting to share what you love with students. Even better when they are interested too.
cons: When push comes to shove, what admin cares about is not teaching quality and testing to the objectives, but pass rates. Many professors lessen the rigor and content of the course work to achieve the aim of a good pass rate, some even offer ridiculous levels of bonus and extra credit to inflate students grades (even when forbidden by department policy). If you are not willing to do this, advisors give preference filling the classes of those they deem easy. Disappointing experience overall.

pros: There are some great people still there to work with. Decent pay
cons: Favoritism, direct administration do not mentor or provide guidance. There is too many people in positions that have little responsibility in administration and very few to actually do work. HR act as if they are the strong arm of the college and hold too much power.

pros: Good coworkers/people to know. College culture is intelligent and values intelligence highly.
cons: Busy, they often did not provide an office or proper working space, instead of shuffling me from computer day-to-day. I did not feel like I "belonged" or even that I was valued.

job_title: Student Worker in Winter Haven, FL
pros: Pros about working at Polk State as a Work Study is you get great job experience in the area that you are placed, you learn how to work with others, and the most important part is you can get an education while working there in between classes
cons: There are no cons about this job.

pros: Small company, decent benefits, top heavy so opportunities for growth, community supports efforts of the college well. Lots of paid holidays
cons: Hiring process is extremely slow and inefficient. Took 4 months to complete the process. Hiring questions were to specific to job process that an external applicant wouldn't necessarily be able to answer

review_title: It has been a positive experience.
pros: This college has a "family feeling" and there is a sense of closeness. It is positive to have one academic dean vs various deans in different departments.
cons: The salaries are lower than those of neighboring counties. Many other job opportunities are not available.

review_title: A world-class institution with a family feeling
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Winter Haven, FL
pros: The school has a dynamic and supportive administrative staff.  Faculty are very focused on student learning.  Polk State is truly a school for the community.
cons: Compensation and benefits are not the best.

review_title: Great place to work while going to school
pros: Very convenient to be working where you are going to school. Teachers were helpful. Hours and days flexible. My input was always encouraged.
cons: Pay was not terrific. Only paid once a month. Lack of communication between tutoring staff.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Winter Haven, FL
pros: Great school to work for and plenty of opportunities
cons: To many bosses telling you what to do

pros: Work with some of the most talented and intelligent people around
cons: Can not think of anything negative

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Winter Haven, FL
pros: Co-workers are great to work with.
cons: The pay for adjuncts could be higher

pros: Some wonderful people work at Polk. They offer great benefits.
cons: Some political extremists work at Polk.

pros: A great place to work.
cons: There are no cons to working here.
